data.title: Tom Cruise
data.meta_description:
In 2006, Forbes magazine voted Tom Cruise the most powerful celebrity in Hollywood. He has appeared in numerous classics including Top Gun, Risky Business and Jerry McGuire.

Cruise's personal life has often been a subject of scrutiny. He has been married to Mimi Rogers and Nicole Kidman. In 2007, he was married to actress Katie Holmes.
data.text:
In 2006, Forbes magazine voted Tom Cruise the most powerful celebrity in Hollywood. Born Thomas Cruise Mapother IV on July 3, 1962, in Syracuse New York, he is an actor and producer who first became known for his role in the 1983 film Risky Business.

He has starred in seven films that have made over a hundred million dollars and his resume includes such blockbusters as Top Gun, Vanilla Sky, The Last Samurai, A Few Good Men, Eyes Wide Shut, Magnolia, and Jerry McGuire for which he was nominated for an academy award in 1996.

While shooting Days of Thunder in 1990, which he co-wrote, he was introduced to his second wife, fellow actor, Nicole Kidman. The couple was married for eleven years and have two children, Isabella and Connor. Prior to Kidman, he was married to Mimi Rogers from 1987-1990 and was married to Katie Holmes as of 2007, with whom he has one child, Suri, born in 2006.

Cruise is an outspoken Scientologist and is known for his criticism of psychiatry.

In 2006, Paramount Pictures announced that they were ending their fourteen year relationship with Cruise and his partner Paula Wagner. Later that year, the pair took control of United Artist film studio where Cruise was to produce and star in film projects and Wagner was to be chief executive of the company.
